greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) is the sum of prime divisors of A302033(n).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..8191
mathematica: Array[Total@ Prime@ Flatten@ Position[#, 1] &@ Reverse@ IntegerDigits[BitXor[#, Floor[#/2]], 2] &, 88, 0] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Apr 27 2018 *)
program: (PARI) first(n) = {my(pr = primes(1 + logint(n, 2)), ex = vector(#pr, i, 1), res = vector(n)); res[1] = 0; for(i = 1, n-1, v = valuation(i, 2); res[i + 1] = res[i] + pr[v++] * ex[v]; ex[v]*=-1); res}; \\ _David A. Corneth_, Apr 18 2018
A019565(n) = {my(j,v); factorback(Mat(vector(if(n, #n=vecextract(binary(n), "-1..1")), j, [prime(j), n[j]])~))}; \\ From A019565
results.author: _David A. Corneth_ & _Antti Karttunen_, Apr 18 2018
